column119: description:"ABC News is your trusted source on political news stories and videos. Get the latest coverage and analysis on everything from the Trump presidency

column162: text:"Former Vice President Dick Cheney dead at 84"
column200: headline:"Former Vice President Dick Cheney dead at 84"
column201: subheadline:"The former vice president was a key architect of the war on terror and Iraq war."
column202: shortHeadline:"Former Vice President Dick Cheney dead at 84"
column203: shortHomepageHeadline:"Former Vice President Dick Cheney dead at 84"
column204: socialHeadline:"Former Vice President Dick Cheney dead at 84"
column206: considered by many political observers to be the most politically active and influential vice president in U.S. history
column207:
has died. He was 84.

\"Richard B. Cheney
column208: the 46th Vice President of the United States
column212: \" his family said in a statement. \"He was 84 years old. His beloved wife of 61 years
column216:
and other family members were with him as he passed. The former Vice President died due to complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.\"

He worked for nearly four decades in Washington. He served as the youngest White House chief of staff under President Gerald Ford; represented Wyoming in the U.S. House of Representatives -- where he worked with congressional leadership and President Ronald Reagan; was secretary of defense under President George H.W. Bush; and later served two terms as vice president under Bush's son
column217:
President George W. Bush.

He was also CEO of Halliburton
column218:
an energy company based in Texas that had a global presence.

When terrorists attacked the United States on Sept. 11
column220:
it was Cheney who first took charge while the president was out of Washington.

\"When the president came on the line
column221: I told him that the Pentagon had been hit and urged him to stay away from Washington
column223: \"In My Time.\" \"The city was under attack
column224: and the White House was a target. I understood that he didn't want to appear to be on the run
column225:
but he shouldn't be here until we knew more about what was going on.\"

He and senior staff gathered at the Presidential Emergency Operations Center
column226:
where they monitored the horror unfolding.

\"I stayed up into the morning hours thinking about what the attack meant and how we should respond
column227: \" Cheney wrote in his memoir. \"We were in a new era and needed an entirely new strategy to keep America secure. The first war of the twenty-first century wouldn't simply be a conflict of nation against nation
column228: army against army. It would be first and foremost a war against terrorists who operated in the shadows
column230:
and would use any weapon they could get their hands on to destroy us.\"

As vice president
column231:
Cheney was also known as the mastermind behind much of the Bush administration's strategy in Iraq.

\"His power is unparalleled in the history of the republic
column235: a research fellow at The Heritage Foundation
column237:
told ABC's \"Nightline\" in 2005.

Cheney said he looked upon his role as vice president as being an adviser to the president.

\"I don't run anything
column238: I'm not in charge of a department or a particular policy area and for me to be out all of the time commenting on the issues of the day -- pontificating if you will -- on what's going on
column239: to some extent infringes upon everybody else in the administration
column240: especially with those specific people who have got specific responsibilities
column241: \" he told ABC News Chief Global Affairs Martha Raddatz in an interview in March 2008
column242:
when she was a White House correspondent.

And later
column244: \"The World According to Dick Cheney\" the former vice president said
column245: \"Tell me what terrorist attacks you would have let go forward because you didn't want to be a mean and nasty fellow. Are you going to trade the lives of a number of people because you want to preserve your honor
column246: or are you going to do your job
column248:
first and foremost your responsibility is to safeguard the United States of America and the lives of its citizens.\"

After his time in office ended
column249:
he remained politically active while former President George W. Bush had moved back to Texas and refrained from commenting on politics in an effort to avoid \"undermining\" the current president.

During President Barack Obama's administration
column250:
Cheney emerged as an outspoken critic of the president's national security policies -- charging that Obama's counterterrorism policies were making the country less safe.

\"It has always been easy for those who are evil to kill
column251: but now it is possible for a few to do so on an unimaginable scale
column252:
\" Cheney wrote in his 2011 memoir.

\"The key
column254: is to choose serious and vigilant leaders
column255: to listen to the men and women who want us to entrust them with high office and judge whether they are saying what they think we want to hear or whether they have the larger cause of the country in mind
column256: \" he continued. \"It's not always easy to move beyond pleasing promises
column257: but in the case of America
column258:
the greater good is so grand.\"

This is a developing story. Please check back for updates.

ABC News' Benjamin Siegel contributed to this report.

"
